Module scrabble.main
Package cl.uchile.dcc.scrabble.T3Shenanigans.ControlDeFlujo

Class ScrFor

java.lang.Object
cl.uchile.dcc.scrabble.T3Shenanigans.ControlDeFlujo.ScrFor
All Implemented Interfaces:
TreeNodes
public class ScrFor
extends java.lang.Object
implements TreeNodes
Class that handles the for loop for scrabble

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    ScrFor​(TreeNodes init, TreeNodes condition, TreeNodes increment, TreeNodes doThis)
    The constructor method for the loop (very similar to the c initialization of a for loop)

    Getter fot the instruction of a true condition

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • ScrFor

      public ScrFor​(TreeNodes init, TreeNodes condition, TreeNodes increment, TreeNodes doThis)
      The constructor method for the loop (very similar to the c initialization of a for loop)
      Parameters:
      init - the variable to be constantly updated and compared in the condition, expected to be a Node Int or Float (and maybe binary wink wink)
      condition - the condition for the loop, when it stops being true, the for loop is going to end
      increment - the increment applied to the init param after each loop, expected to be a Node Int or float (once again, it might even accept binary, wink)
      doThis - the instruction to be executed

  • Method Details

    • eval

      public ScrNode eval()
      creates the visitor object and then sends it to the accept method in this class
      Specified by:
      eval in interface TreeNodes
      Returns:
      nothing, it sends the instruction to the accept class

    • accept

      public ScrNode accept​(Visitor v)
      Sends to the visitor class
      Parameters:
      v - the visitor object
      Returns:
      it will be nothing, but the action will be executed by the visitor

    • getIncrement

      public TreeNodes getIncrement()
      Getter of the increment for the initial variable that indicates how long the for will stay active
      Returns:
      the increment for the initial variable

    • getInit

      public TreeNodes getInit()
      Getter of the initial variable that indicates how long the for will stay active
      Returns:
      the initial variable

    • getStopCondition

      public TreeNodes getStopCondition()
      Getter of the condition under which the for will stop
      Returns:
      the condition under which the for will stop

      public TreeNodes getDoThis()
      Getter fot the instruction of a true condition
      Returns:
      instruction of a true condition
